citeinfo.title: SFP_watershed
citeinfo.othercit: This database was created by William Lettis & Associates, Inc. for the Oakland Museum of California and the San Francisco Estuary Institute (SFEI), under a grant from the State Water Resources Control Board through CNPS Pollution Control Grant agreement No. 04-139-552-0 awarded to SFEI. Supplemental funding was provided by the City of San Francisco Public Utilities Commission, and San Mateo Countywide Water Pollution Prevention Program. Copies of the database can be obtained from the San Francisco Estuary Institute, Oakland, CA.

descript.abstract: This shapefile delineates the current watersheds and bay fill of the San Francisco Peninsula. Most watersheds are defined by point of entry into the bay, slough, or ocean. Within the city of San Francisco, however, most watersheds coincide with sewersheds defined by the San Francisco Department of Public Works. Bay fill is defined as artificially made land outboard of the historical shoreline. This database was designed to help the general public and regional planners understand how water flows through San Francisco Peninsula watersheds.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this shapefile is to illustrate the watershed areas and areas of bay fill within the San Francisco Peninsula Creek Map study area. These digital GIS files represent the same polygons as published on the Oakland Museum's Creek & watershed map series.

sngdate.caldate: The polygons in this digital database represent the most current data available at the time of data compilation. If users have concerns that these data are not up to date, they are encouraged to contact the local city government that has jurisdiction over the area in question.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.accconst: This work is public domain and we encourage the public to use the information openly and appropriately.
idinfo.useconst: These data were compiled at 1:24,000 scale and are a regional dataset. This dataset is not a substitute for a site-specific engineering study of surface hydrology.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

Teresa Ramirez-Herrera, Anne Tillery, Christopher Richard, Sarah Pearce, Ranon Dulberg, and Jason Holmberg, 2007, Creek and watershed map of the San Francisco Peninsula: a digital database, version 1.1, William Lettis & Associates, Inc., Walnut Creek, CA.

horizpa.horizpar: All data should be considered approximate.

procstep.procdesc: This shapefile was created from Freehand files and imported into Arcview using a Freehand extension called Map Publisher. The shapefile was then registered to the Stateplane coordinate system using an Arcview Tool called Spatial Adjustment. These data were compiled at a scale of 1:24,000 and will be accurate at this scale. Use of the data at larger scales would be inappropriate as data may appear erroneous when enlarged.

srcinfo.srccontr: Watershed polygons were compiled primarily from city and county drainage basin data, interpretation of city and county storm drainage maps, and interpretation of USGS topographic maps. Bay fill was mapped by comparison of the historical shoreline (SFEI EcoAtlas ver 1.5) and the modern shoreline as seen on modern USGS 7.5-minute quadrangle maps and 2004 aerial photography. A complete list of sources is provided in PeninsulaCreeksGIS_Readme_ver.1.1. Additional documentation can be obtained from Janet Sowers at William Lettis & Associates, Inc. in Walnut Creek, or at www.museumca.org/creeks/ .

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Specifies the drainage of the watershed. Also delineates the portions of the bay that have been artificially filled.

edom.edomvd: Artificial fill that creates land, located in areas shown on the SFEI EcoAtlas to have been open bay circa 1850.
